NewsDetail.Name: 07-14-11 Spring Commencement
NewsDetail.Title: Paul K. Sybrowsky speaks at Spring Commencement
NewsDetail.Abstract: Paul K. Sybrowsky, a member of the Second Quorum of the Seventy for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, will address 1,466 graduates at Brigham Young University-Idahoâ€™s Spring Commencement on July 22.
NewsDetail.Author: Writer: Scott Haycock
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
Paul K. Sybrowsky, a member of the Second Quorum of the Seventy for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, will address 1,466 graduates at Brigham Young University-Idaho's Spring Commencement on July 22. The event will be held at 5 p.m. in the BYU-Idaho Center.


Elder Sybrowsky was sustained a member of the Second Quorum of the Seventy on April 2, 2005, and now serves as an assistant executive director in the Church History and Audiovisual Departments. He previously served as a counselor and president in the Australia Area Presidency. Prior to his call to serve as a full-time General Authority, Elder Sybrowsky served the Church as president of the Canada Toronto West Mission.


Additionally, Elder Sybrowsky was the general manager of Canada and Eurpoe for ADP Dealer Services and the founding partner and president of Dynix Library Systems. He also served in the Northwest Commission for Colleges and Universities and as the chair of the Board of Trustees of Utah Valley State College.


For more information about commencement, visit www.byui.edu/graduation.
